question.body: Which of the following correctly describes the two parts of the adrenal glands?

multiple_choice.choice: The adrenal cortex produces catecholamine hormones and the adrenal medulla produces steroid hormones.
The adrenal cortex is endocrine and the adrenal medulla is neurosecretory.
The adrenal cortex is on the inside and the adrenal medulla is on the outside.
The adrenal medulla and adrenal cortex are from the same embryonic tissue.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The adrenal cortex produces steroid hormones and the adrenal medulla produces catecholamine hormone.
Correct. The adrenal gland is like two glands wrapped together. The adrenal cortex is endocrine and the adrenal medulla is neurosecretory.
Incorrect. The adrenal cortex is the outer layer of the adrenal gland and the adrenal medulla is the inner layer.
Incorrect. The adrenal medulla and the adrenal cortex come from different tissues.
